11113222111111.content:
"AH!" You shout, eyes shooting open as a very fat and very stupid fly lands noisily on the bridge of your nose awaking you from what had been a very good dream. Before you can even understand what is happening you feel yourself spinning, then falling, then hitting your forehead on something. For a few moments you stare at the ceiling in a complete daze, unable to fathom what was going on. Then it all came back to. Alkazar, the wish, detaching your head and making your body sentient and sending it off to school in your stead, everything. Attempting to move your memories are confirmed, your entire body from the chin down had gone numb, and was in fact nowhere to be seen. "Holy shit, I really did make everyone detachable." You say aloud, still coming to terms with the gravity of your actions. A million thoughts went through your head which was all that was left of you at the moment. What was your body up to right now? Why didn't you wish for super powers? Is your sentient body its own being or a continuation of your own soul? If it's still you then is it just a golem like husk pantomiming your will? If it's no longer you then does it currently have its own rights? God damn your nose was itchy.
"Is everything alright Eric? I heard shouting." A familiar voice calls out. Soon enough you saw Cynthia walking over you, dripping wet and clad only in a towel as she rushed to see the cause of the commotion. Standing over your head you got a great look at her silky smooth and still slightly soapy snatch.
"I'm better now." You cheekily respond, causing Cynthia to look down and take notice of your head on the floor. Her cheeks redden slightly and you feel a light playful kick to the jaw send you rolling across your floor, head stopping a few feet away looking up at Cynthia's covered upper half.
"Did you really do all that just to catch an upskirt you little perv?" She asked, crossing her arms in exasperation.
You're tempted to say yes as a joke but decide not to push your luck as you currently lacked any way to defend yourself if Cynthia didn't take kindly to your particular brand of humor. "No, a fly woke me up and I forgot I was resting on my chin so when I yelled I accidentally rolled myself over." You explain.
"Ah." She huffs, noting that indeed there was a large fly buzzing about your room. "In any event I was just about to wake you for lunch, would you like anything?"
You raise an eyebrow. "Uh, I don't know if you've noticed but I don't exactly have a stomach for anything at the moment."
"You could still just have something for the fun of it. Heck, I love eating bodiless as I don't have a figure to worry about." She replies.
You consider this, while you weren't hungry and your mom wasn't exactly a five star chef you could still go for some food, especially if indeed you could eat as much as you wanted without worrying about getting stuffed. "Alright, good point. I could go for some lunch."
Cynthia nodded. "Alright, I'll whip up something for you. In the meantime would you like me to put you in front of the TV? Or Stephanie's laptop? I know she spends a lot more time armless than you so she's got a voice controlled model."
"Laptop." You say. While watching what sort of programs existed in this new world did intrigue you having access to the internet would allow you to look up all of your body related questions and would give you a much bigger picture of the sort of effects your wish had had. Noticing Cynthia was glaring disapprovingly at you you remembered your manners and asked "Would you please be so kind as to set me up at my sister Stephenie's laptop?"
"Much better." She said. Carefully leaning over so as not to give you another upskirt Cynthia carried you over to your sister's room and set you down beside your sister's laptop. While you didn't have much time to observe before getting put in front of computer which faced a wall you did notice that Stephenie and Rachel's closets were absolutely massive in this universe, probably to store clothing of much greater variety to fit whatever form they needed. Maybe it even housed some spare body parts. Your thoughts turned to the screen in front of you as Cynthia opened up your sister's computer and plugged in a specialized microphone into the side. You wake up and instantly realize something is wrong. The ceiling is blank white, light faintly wafting down from behind the fluorescent panes. You sit up from your bed, which was much less comfortable than you remember. You are surprised to find that you were lying on a flat metal operating table, hence your sore back. You were naked, though you are certain you went to sleep wearing something.
Your room was a blank ten by ten box with nothing else in it but the table. You were so confused. You know you asked to be surprised, but you didn't expect whatever was happening. You here a click and look up to see that what appeared to just be a wall was actually a door, though there was no handle on your side. A woman walk in, its...
"MOM?!" You exclaim in surprise. Your beautiful mom Cynthia was dressed in a lab coat, though her rather ample buxom was barely contained by it. She looked slightly older, a few grey bags under her more weary eyes. She smiled as she looked up from her clipboard.
"Oh, you're awake earlier than expected! How are you Eric-14?"
Your eyes nearly pop out of your sockets "ERIC-14?! What the hell do you mean Eric-14?! What's going on here?!"
Her eyebrow raises as her expression changes from happy to observant. "Hmm. It appears the damage to your memory was more severe than anticipated. Perhaps the experiment was premature."
"MOM!!! WHAT ARE YOU SAYING?!" You inquire, grabbing a hold of her shoulders and shaking her slightly so she'll acknowledge you.
"Eric-14, this might be hard for you to here, especially with your brain not functioning as it should. Eric, you're a clone."
"WHAT?!" You ask incredulously.
"The original Eric died years ago. He was hit by a bus, cruelly stolen from his family by fate. I was full of grief, and the family was devastated. I went back to school. I got an advanced degree in bio-engineering. I got government backing, and soon, I cloned him. I cloned my son to bring him back. I cloned you."
This was heavy. You blinked with the realization that in this world you weren't really you.
"Eric wasn't perfect though. He was fragile, he could be hurt. When he was hurt, we all were equally in pain. I swore to remake him so that he was perfect. I've tried so much, replicating him with slight variations to improve him. To make him so perfect that he could not be stolen, and if he was I could rebuild him."
You thought she had gone crazy! She sounded totally off her rocker mad! You couldn't accuse her yet though. You were in her facility, and you still had questions that you needed answers to. "So, what did you do to me... him... us to make me different?"
She looks into your eyes and grins, some levity entering her eyes again. "I'm pretty proud of you in particular. For you I..."
Option 1:
"Made it so that you could not die. Any damage your body takes will be healed in a matter of hours, restoring you exactly the way you were. I removed a piece of your brain yesterday to see how that would heal, and while it did grow back you apparently lost the memories stored in that section of your mind."
Option 2:
"Made you into a goo like substance that can reshape into anything you want. You can separate and reform on a cellular level with ease, and cannot be harmed by conventional means. Yesterday I took a small piece of you and disposed of it to see what would happen. I guess you lost a few of your memories as a result of the destruction."

"Uh, Mom, do you think I could maybe have a little privacy?" you requested.

Your stepmother blinked. "Whatever for? I created you remember? Do you seriously think that there's anything you have that I haven't seen before?" She asked, amused by your reaction judging by the grin she's wearing.

"Fine." you sigh, shucking the hospital gown and scrambling into the clothes as quickly as possible, but not before receiving a wolf whistle and a suggestion of "Take it off! Take it all off baby!" from your step mom. Not pleased by the comments you blush bright red, glaring at her, which only causes her to laugh all the harder. It wasn't that you were ashamed of your body or anything, but the idea of being treated like a piece of meat by your own step mom... Well it wasn't pleasant.
It would have been different if you weren't the only one undressed, as you'd long fantasized about that hot body of hers, but as it was... not pleasant.

"What's wrong Eric, it's okay for you to fantasize about your poor old step mother, but when she does the same to you it's suddenly wrong?" Cynthia teases. Having no real answer for that, you remain silent, and continue to dress. Once you finish, you sigh "Lets get this over with."

Following your step mom out the door, you find yourself in a long hallway with doors along either side. After walking a short ways, the two of you come to an open doorway leading into what looks like a waiting room of some sort, inside of which you see several people who look like nothing so much as older versions of Stephanie Rachel and Randell, as well as nearly a dozen individuals which look close enough to you that they could well be your identical twin if over half of them weren't girls.

Being the first to spot you, one of the ___________ clones gets up and rushes over to greet you.
132111.title: "No of course not. I was talking about the ...

choices: your slime body''
your four armed body''
1321111.content:
''hey, you must be the #14 right?'' says a clone of you who is walking toward you but than you see that he looked a bit strange

''ehm.... yeah... i think, i am more shocked by you and your _____ body'' you say

''yeah, i hear that from every new clone'' the clone says
1321111.title: Male clones.

choices: Male clone this time.
Another female. The male yous must be antisocial or something.
1321112.content:
Spotting you, one of the female clones this one with long blonde hair and dressed in a pink blouse, black miniskirt, and a set of black three inch pumps hops up and rushes over, throwing her arms around you in a crushing hug. "Oh my God! I'm so glad that they let you out so that I can finally get to meet you! Welcome to the family little brother!' she gushes, her D cup tits pressing against your chest making you far more uncomfortably aware of her female status far more than her clothing and appearance ever could have.

"Uh yea, about that, who are you anyway?" you ask. The woman stands around five foot seven, and appears a bit older than you, probably in her late teens or early twenties with a slender yet curvaceous figure and judging by her face, she's almost certainly one of your clones, but for some reason, her personality is totally different, as is her hair color. The hair is easy enough to explain, as it's not as though you've never seen a bottle blonde before, but the differences in her personality are..disturbing. She's way too girly, even for a girl, at least one with your memories and basic outlook, making you wonder if your step mom messed with her mind somehow. "Oh I forgot, you've got brain damage! I'm Candice, also known as Eric number 7. Say, you want to see something cool?" She asked teasingly.

Before you can gather your thoughts enough to answer, another girl steps up behind a heavy hand lands on Candice's shoulder, pulling her away from you. The new girl is a little older than Candice, as well as being a bit taller than her, or you for that matter, standing just a little over six feet tall, with a muscular but not unattractive build and shoulder length light brown hair. Clothing wise, she's dressed much like yourself, in a simple outfit consisting of jeans and a T-shirt which, while fairly loose, still fails to do much to hide the large pair of tits she's sporting, which are, if anything, even larger than candices, though they seem a bit smaller thanks to her larger frame. "Hey, lay off him blondie, he just woke up, there will be time for stuff like that latter." she says, before stepping in front of you and holding her hand out for you to shake. Cautiously,you return the gesture, her grip powerful enough to be almost painful. You make a mental note never to piss her off if you can help it, as she'd likely kick your ass in a heartbeat. "Hey, I'm Ursula, also known as Eric number 4." the new girl says. "Stay on my good side and we'll do fine, piss me off and you're dead meat, got it?" the towering amazon says.

"Uh, sure, no problem." you replied nervously, pissing off the muscular female being the last thing on your mind.

"Good deal. I thought you might have turned out like that last jerk. Anyway, if anyone of these other bozos," Ursala says pointing her thumb back over her shoulder, "or anyone else for that matter, gives you any trouble that you can't handle come to me alright? I'll straighten them out." before ruffling your hair a bit and walking off, sitting down next to... "Wait, is that... It is, it is Taylor! But why does he look so old? And why is he sitting so close too..." you wonder to yourself, until suddenly, it hits you! Judging by the look of things your old friend Taylor and your amazonian clone are now an item, or at least good friends judging by how close they are to one another. You'll have to check into this latter, as you still have people to meet, one of which is approaching you right now, this one a______________?
1321112.title: Female clones.

choices: "It may take me some time to adjust, but you all are my family, so I'll stay."
"Sorry, but this is just too much for me to deal with right now." you reply.
13211121.content:
Another clone approaches you, a male one this time, followed by an athletic blonde woman who looks eerily familiar.

The male clone, who looks just like you except for being maybe a couple years older holds out his hand for you to shake, smiles and says, "Hey, I'm Eric number 12, also known as Dan Jr., and this is my girlfriend..." the clone doesn't get to finish as you suddenly recognize the girl he's with, rushing past him and and grabbing, picking her up and twirling her around before smiling brilliantly and exclaiming "Oh my God! Monica, it's so good to see you! I thought you might have moved on to someone else!" you gushed, causing the startled blonde haired girl to blink, staring at you in slack jawed silence for a moment. You realize immediately that something's not right though. This girl does look an awful lot like your former girlfriend, but not quite. Also, judging by Taylor's appearance, shouldn't she be older than this?

Suddenly, a heavy hand lands on your shoulder as an angry male voice, one very similar to your own, growls "Hey asshole, let go of my girlfriend!"

Glancing behind you, you see, much as you had expected, your angry male clone staring back at you. He looks pissed, and having no idea what strange powers he may possess, you let go and back off, stammering "G-girl friend?! But, but..." This isn't right! Monica is suppose to be your girlfriend, not some impostors! But looking back at her, you begin to wonder, is this girl really Monica at all? You'd thought so at first, but now...

Your suspicions are confirmed seconds latter when the male clone, Dan he called himself Sneers and says "Yes girlfriend. Haley's mine, and don't you forget it!" he snarls.

"Haley?" you gasp, more than a little surprised by this revelation. No wonder she looks so much like Monica! The girl in front of you is Monica's little sister all grown up. The two of them had always looked pretty similar, but now... if Monica still looks anything like she use to, they could almost be twins!

"Yes Haley. My sister's got kids to take care of, so she couldn't be here." Haley explained.

"Kids! Who's?!" you demanded, not sure how many more surprises you could take in one day.

"Hers and Eric's, who did you think? Don't you remember?" Haley asked, clearly puzzled by your response.

"He's got a bit of brain damage, I told you all about it remember?" your step mother puts in from the corner she's been standing all this time while waiting for the introductions to finish.

"M-my kids! But how? Why? I can't be a father, I'm not ready!" you stammered, unable to deal with what they were telling you, not quite understanding the truth yet.

"But their not your kids." Haley pointed out. "Their my sisters and Eric's. Eric number 10 I guess you could call him, the first of the surviving male clones." she explained.

"What! You mean there's some dime store knock off of me running around living my life and stealing my girlfriend!" you growled, so angry now that you were practically frothing at the mouth.

Apparently not being the most diplomatic of individuals, the male clone identified as Dan explained "But it's not your life. You're a clone, just like the rest of us. And you're not the first either, not by a long shot. You're number 14, the new kid on the block, the low man on the totem pole, the..." you don't let him finish. You were already angrier than you've ever been, barely in control of yourself, ready to lash out at the first target that presents itself, and Dan had just had to go and make it worse, essentially painting a bulls-eye on himself. Screaming with rage, you launch yourself at him, punching him in the face with a right hook, knocking him to the floor, then jumping on top of him and punching at him repeatedly, attempting to pummel him into submission. Before you can land more than a couple of punches however, a faintly glowing energy barrier springs into existence between the two of you, deflecting your punches. Not to be deterred, you keep punching anyway, hoping that if you keep at it the shield will eventually crack, allowing you to inflict more damage.

Suddenly though, you're picked up from behind and tossed to the ground face first. You move to get up, but before you can do so, a large body lands on top of you, forcing you back down, your face pressing against the tile below you.

Grabbing you by the hair and twisting your head around sideways, allowing you to view them, the man on top of you leans in close to you and growls "Calm down Eric 14, that's no way for brothers to behave. And just for the record, Monica is my wife, not your girlfriend, and if you have a problem , you should take it up with me, not Dan, he's not the one responsible. I'm Eric 10 by the way, but you can just call me Eric. I'm your older brother. I'm going to let you up now, but if you try anything stupid, I'll put you back down, hard this time got it?" the older version of you growled.

You don't like being forced to give in, but you knew there was nothing you could do in your current position, so, after taking a few slow deep breaths to try and calm yourself, you reluctantly nodded.

Nodding in turn, the older clone stands up and reaches down, offering his hand to help you up. You snarl, slapping the hand away, before getting to your feet under your own power, glaring angrily at the man who had, by his own admission, taken Monica from you.

Eric seemed less than impressed, standing there staring at you with that steely gaze of his, arms crossed in front of his chest. Studying the older man, you realized several things. One, he was taller than you. Oh, not by much, only a couple of inches, but enough to be noticeable. Two, he was also more muscular, a lot more, his body having filled out significantly after reaching adulthood, most likely supplemented by lots of strenuous exercise. He looked a lot like your dad actually, but younger and more muscular, but with your face, but older and harder. If you had to guess, you'd probably place his age somewhere around his mid to late twenties. His hair is light brown, the same color as yours, but short and spiky, more like the way Randell wore his in your own reality. Dresses in a leather jacket, Jeans and a set of combat boots, this older you was more than a little intimidating, radiating a confidence that seemed to say to everyone around him "I can kick your ass and not even break a sweat, so you'd better not try anything stupid."

With this in mind, you decide that attacking him probably wouldn't be the best idea. Sure you'd heal from whatever he decided to do to you within a matter of hours, but it would still hurt, probably a lot, as you suspect that the older you is fully aware of your healing factor, and would therefor go all out, inflicting as much damage as possible as he doesn't have to worry about killing you. Besides, even if you somehow won the fight, it wasn't as though it would bring Monica back to you. She and this jerk were married now, even had kids! What could you offer that could compare to that?

After allowing you to stew quietly for a moment, the older you finally speaks. He seems calmer now, almost apologetic. "Look, I know this is hard on you Eric. It was for me too when I woke up, and to be honest, if I woke up and found out my girlfriend was married to another man, I'd probably react the same as you. But the fact is, Monica and I are married now. Neither of us are the original, but I came first, so I won the prize so to speak. You can either accept that and move on with your life, or go nuts over it and end up in an insane asylum somewhere, but either way, I won't let you do anything to harm my marriage or my family. Speaking of family, I'd really like it if you could find it within yourself to become a part of ours, but I'll understand if this is all too weird for you, though mom might be a different story." he said, nodding towards your step mom, who seemed worried and more than a little upset over the events that had just occurred, but she hadn't interfered yet, allowing the older clone to handle things for the moment.

The older clone looks back at you arching one eyebrow, waiting for your response.

The whole situation really is freaking you out, not to mention pissing you off, but do you really want to abandon your new family just because things have gotten a little weird? You're not sure, and that scares you. You know you have to give them some sort of answer though, so after a bit of careful consideration, something unusual for you, you reply that_________________________?
13211121.title: Male clone this time.

choices: Experiment A or B.
Experiment C or D.
13212.content:
"Uh... What sort of experiment?" you asked nervously, none to eager to volunteer after hearing about the succession of terrible things you're step mom's subjected you to already.

"Oh, nothing too bad. In fact, as long as nothing goes wrong you'll probably enjoy it!" your mother replies.

Not being particularly reassured by the if nothing goes wrong part, you can't help but give your step mother a skeptical look.

Noticing your expression, Cynthia says "Hey! Don't look at me like that! I was serious when I said all the bad stuff was over with. This device I want you top test should be perfectly safe, I'm only asking for you to be the first one to try it out because I feel like I owe you a favor for all the other horrible stuff I was forced to put you through."

"Plus the fact that I'm pretty much indestructible makes me the perfect guinea pig am I right?" you added.

"Well... that is part of it, but that's really just a bonus." Cynthia replies, adding "Look, how about I tell you a little more about the project and then you can decide whether you're willing to help me or not, deal?"

You considered it. Knowing what you were getting yourself into, at least to some degree, was a lot better than jumping in head first without knowing the situation, and you could always back out if you decided Cynthia was asking too much of you. "Okay, I accept. Tell me about the project." you agreed.

"You're actually thinking about it?!" Cynthia said, seemingly surprised by your willingness to help. Maybe you'd made the wrong choice?

Either ignoring your renewed nervousness or else choosing to ignore it, Cynthia continues. "There are several actually. The one I was thinking you might be interested in involves___________________?

(A). "My new mind swap machine. You could see what it would be like to be another person, or maybe even an animal!"

(B). "The new portal devices I've just invented. They were originally designed for transport by allowing items to pass between pairs of portals or placed into a pocket dimension for easy storage, but I'm sure if you experiment with them a little, I'm sure you can find a more interesting use for them if you know what I mean."

(C). "My new mass transference device. Basically what it does is move mass around from one object to another, making them lighter or denser, bigger or smaller, or both. You can also just change the size and/or mass of a part of an object if you wanted to. Actually, the only real limitation it has is that mass has to remain constant, meaning that if something else gets bigger or denser, something else has to get smaller or lighter. I haven't tried it on humans yet of course, but if works on you the way it should I'll let you have it for field testing."

(D)More projects.
13212.title: "So, do you feel like helping me with anoth...

choices: "The mind swap device. It'll be fun seeing what it's like to be someone else."
"The portal devices. I can already see all sorts of interesting uses for them."
132121.content:
"What where those first two again?" you ask.

Sighing in exasperation, your mother says "Weren't you listening?! Alright, I'll tell you about them again, but pay attention this time okay? The first project involves testing my new mind swap machine. You could see what it would be like to be another person, or maybe even an animal! Of course we'll be doing human to human testing first since it's safer and less likely to cause serious side effects on the off chance something were to go wrong." Cynthia explains.

"Sounds interesting. So what about the second one?" You ask.

"The second project has a lot to do with pocket dimensions, using them to store stuff or travel quickly from one place to the other through the use of special portals I've created. They work fine for shipping stuff short distances and for storing inanimate objects, but I've been afraid to try in out on a living person. Of course, with your regeneration ability, you should be perfectly safe even if something does wind up happening. And hey, if the portals work for humans as well as they do for everything else, well, lets just say it'll open up all sorts of interesting new possibilities." your mother said with a smile that hinted at all sorts of sexy things to come if everything went well.

"Huh, they both sound interesting, if not exactly safe." you replied. "Still, what's a little risk to someone that's immortal right? I think I'll try.......?"

"I'm almost afraid to ask but, what are the other projects like?" you inquire.

I haven't tried it on humans yet of course, but if works on you the way it should I'll let you have it for field testing."

132122.title: Experiment C or D.

choices: When Eric wakes up the next morning, the new virus is all over the news.
Shortly after the visit from Alkazar, Eric begins feeling hot and feverish.
Readers choice. (Leave room for more than one option.)
133.content: Alkazar was at a loss. He had offered the boy Eric a once in a lifetime opportunity to change the world to match his desires, only to be all but ignored, and told simply to surprise him! It was unheard of, it was unacceptable, and Alkazar wasn't about to stand for it. Alkazar had always considered the human form to be rather boring, as they all looked essentially the same, two eyes, two arms, two legs, one head, always in pretty much the same place. Oh sure, they varied a bit in size and coloration, and then of course there was gender to consider, but other than that, they were practically clones! Alkazar decided to change all that, creating on the spot a previously unknown virus that would warp the bodies of virtually every human it came into contact with, causing them to mutate essentially at random, with men becoming women, women becoming men, humans gaining animal characteristics, growing or shrinking either of the entire person or merely certain body parts, gaining or loosing limbs, eyes, ears, heads, genitals, or essentially any other body part anyone cared to name, repositioning of parts in weird or inconvenient places, body parts becoming detached, sometimes gaining remaining under the original owners control, and sometimes gaining a separate life and personality all their own, muscle growth, sudden spontaneous changes in age, height or weight, differences in skin hair and eye color, groups of people melting together forming a collective of sorts, people tuning into slime, gaining super powers, and a whole host of other changes, all totally random, and all capable of happening over and over again, though becoming less frequent with time as the infected humans began developing antibodies to help fight off the infection before it could change them even further.
133.title: The transformation virus.

choices: The mists clear showing Samantha.
The feed is cut and returns to Kate and Tom.
The noise destroyed all the stations instruments and the broadcast is lost.
1331.content:
The next morning Eric continued on about his day like usual. He woke up, had a shower, got dressed and headed downstairs to get breakfast.

"Hey Eric!", Daniel called to his son with urgency, from the living room. "You have to see this!". Without hesitation Eric soon joined his entire family watching the news.

"This Samantha Smith reporting live from Central Park", the news reporter announced on the TV. Eric thought she was rather cute, with straight, brunette hair going down to her shoulders, olive skin and green eyes. She looked to be about 24 years old and was rather petite . "Where, what was originally thought to be a meteorite, is now been believed to be alien in origin". Eric's family gasped in shock to this news whereas Eric had a sinking feeling that whatever was going had something to do with last night. "Since then the National Guard have set up a quarantine zone until a team can be assembled to investigate this object further, back to you, Tom", Samantha said before coverage cut back to the studio.

"Thank you, Sam", Tom said sitting next to his female co-anchor. "If you are just joining us, I have some shocking news, an alien object has crashed into Central Park over night and though the damage is minimal it's impact has been felt across the globe, humanity is not alone in The Universe" he said in a grim voice. "Kate?".

"Further details are unknown at this time, but the president is expected to hold a press conference within the hour", Tom's co-anchor finishes.

"The objected crashed last night around 7pm EST and was originally thought to be a meteorite but once inspected up close was revealed to be a metallic in nature, since then the entire area has been quarantined until a further assessment is carried out. We remind our viewers to stay calm as their appears to be no threat at this time", Tom assures the public.

Old footage then plays of a fireball appearing above New York City before crashing into the ground, the impact crater, police statements, fire department statements, religious and scientist interviews.

"Breaking News", Kate interrupts the old footage. "It appears now this whole thing has been some sort of elaborate hoax, we go back to Samantha for more".

"Thank you Kate", Samantha once again appears on the TV. "While the fireball and impact crater have yet to be explained there is new indication to believe that whatever the object is it is terrestrial in nature". She then walks over to the commanding officer holding out her Mic. "Sir? Can you please tell us what you have discovered about the object".

The 6 foot soldier towered over Samantha and wore a grim expression on his face. "While we are not clear on the details yet, we can confirm this object is indeed terrestrial", he explains in a dull tone. "It isn't giving off any radioactive signatures and it has a message in English written on the side".

Eric and his family were both relieved and angry to hear this news, to go through all that drama to find out the entire story was a hoax. Eric, Randell and Stephanie were about to leave the living room when Samantha asked an important question. "So what did the message say?", she asked not just for her viewers but for herself as well.

"I suppose it wouldn't hurt....", the command says. "The message on the side of the device clearly says 'To Eric Johnson, Surprise! Regards, Alkazar'".

Eric just froze in shock, while his family briefly looked at him and wondered, though quickly dismissed the idea that it was referring to him as the lived a considerable distance away from New York City and there could be hundreds of Eric Johnsons in the world.

Suddenly a humming noise could be heard from the television. The noise broke Eric out of his frozen state and he returned his attention to the broadcast. Now the Commander and Samantha both were covering their ears as the sound got louder and louder, drowning out all other noise. In fact it was so loud even Eric and his family had to cover their ears before Daniel quickly hit mute on the remote. Then beyond the containment fence a green cloud exploded knocking over the camera and making the screen covered in green mist.
1331.title: News Broadcast

choices: Shut the doors and windows and seal all the gaps...
Into the emergency bunker...
13311.content:
It doesn't take long for the mist to clear from in front of the camera. The camera man is quick to react and picks up his camera once more and starts too survey the damage, only to find the containment wall completely destroyed by the shock wave, giving a cleat view of the device. The camera zooms in to the small sphere showing the words 'Eric Johnson' quite clearly. It also reveals that the device is still active and is spewing endless amounts of gas into the atmosphere. It also seems to be surrounded by several clusters of green goo, though there is no connection to the device so the source of it remains unknown.

The camera then zooms back out and starts scanning the edges of the destroyed fence as if the cameraman is looking for something. That is when Daniel remembers the TV is on mute so he turns the volume back on. Suddenly the TV emits also sorts of sounds, from screaming, the sirens and most loud of all the continued hissing of the device.

"Where are you?", the cameraman yells confirming that the Johnson's missed out on something earlier.

"Over here", Samantha yells out. The camera then focuses back on Samantha or at least her head

"Oh my god...." Your family say in unison as you all see the body-less reporter for the first time.

"Talk to me Simon, what's happening and why can't I move?"

"I don't... I can't...", Simon stumbles out. "You have no body..."

"That's Impossible", Samantha says in denial. The camera then walks over to Samantha's head and you see his hand reach down to pick up Samantha by the hair.

"Look...", he tells her, holding her up so she can see her reflection and also to show the world

"No.. that can't be... I'm still alive, I'm not in pain...", she says to the camera before her hair grows, lowering her head back to the ground. The cameraman shocked by the further activity lets go of her hair, takes a step back and reveals her hair has grown by 4 or 5 feet at least. "Where's my body, Simon... go find my body...", she continues to say in shock.

"I think I found it miss", the commander's voice says off camera. "Or at least it found me..."

The camera the pans right to see when has become of the commander and to everyone's shock, he has four arms, breasts and a vagina all clearly showing. It is upon further inspection that his chest is resting on top of where Samantha's head should be so the top 2 arms head and neck are he's while the rest of the body is Samantha's. "How...?", Samantha asks horrified to see someone not only attached to her body but that is was completely naked.

"What the fence fell, I landed on top of you causing the your head to go flying and somehow your body merged with mine", he explains to her. "He then sees that the cameraman is still recording. "Turn that thing off... I can't let anyone see me like this". The commander the starts to fight the cameraman but due to his current form he fails and falls back onto Samantha, squishing her green goo. That is when the Johnson's realize all that goo they saw before were the workers who were examining the device.

The commander looked shocked to that he had just squashed the reported with her bare behind, though quickly realizes she isn't dead when her hair wraps itself around the body, cocooning it before squishing it, leaving one large pile of goo and the extremely long hair. The camera man watches as the goo fights back and forth trying to separate and even form limbs, but to no affect. Desperate the hair then strikes out like a snake at the cameraman and pulls him into the pile as well squishing him down to goo. With enough material one blob manages to break free and reform, though too it's surprise it becomes a two headed Samantha with both heads splitting the hair equally, while the second blob only manages to become the upper torso and head of Samantha.

"What the hell", the Samantha on the ground exclaims.

"Good question", the Samantha head on the right says.

"All I wanted was my body back", the left Samantha answers.

Angry the torso Samantha jumps back up attacking the two headed Samantha, until they are all one big blob again. This continues for several attempts in front of the camera until the feed is finally cut with the emergency broadcast channel.

"I was wondering why they didn't cut the feed when the explosion hit, they must've evacuated the news room and had no one monitoring the feed", Daniel says.

"I'll say, no news program could get away with that much nudity without being sued", Cynthia agrees.

"Um guys I think there are more important things to discuss than nudity, like the giant slime monsters", Stephanie states.

"I'll say, that shit was hot, though it could've gone without the army guy on the reporter ladies body", Randall points out.

"I was being serious", Stephanie stops her foot on the ground.

"So was I", Randall replies with a smile.

"Um guys...", Rachael interrupts from near the window, apparently she had stopped watching the news a while ago and was hanging out in the kitchen. "Has the sky always been that green?"

Eric and the others run over to the window to see what Rachael was talking about and sure enough the naturally blue sky was losing a war against the encroaching green.

"Alright guys...", Daniel says trying to keep his family calm....
13311.title: The mists clear showing Samantha.

choices: The President? adresses the nation
They begin to transform
One week later: They emerge from the bunker to discover the new world
133112.content:
"I don't know what that hell was going on in that news feed or why the sky is green but I imagine the two things might be related so it's time to head down into the emergency bunker", Daniel commands.

Eric admired his father's survival instincts, even though it was build on the foundations of fear of the Soviet Union. Even after it collapsed he would go on about how it was a ploy and they were still secretly running Russia behind closed doors. Eric wouldn't be surprised if his father thought they were behind the attack, or whatever this was. Though of course he knew better and perhaps he was the only one who truly knew what had happened. Though he now wished he gave Alkazar a proper response.

When the Johnson's made it to their bunker the sky had completely turned green, even the clouds and the sun blanketed allowing for people to safely stare at it.

Daniel finished locking the door and proceeded to turn on the generator. While the others get settled in.

Safe from the mist or gas or whatever it was, Eric felt it was time to confess to his family. "Um, guys there's something I need to tell you....."
133112.title: Into the emergency bunker...

choices: Randell has become Stephanie's ass
Stephanie has become Randell's dick
Something else happens with the rest of the family

She brought her weapon upwards, cutting only through air as you took a step to the left. You were about to make a joke about how poorly she used her tool when she brought her steel down sharply. You weren't expecting her to recover so quickly, and didn't think to move out of the way. You stood there dumbly as she cut clean through your shoulder, sending your right arm flying through the air. You expected pain, but instead were greeted by a surprising normal feeling. Looking at the wound it was covered in smooth skin, the same color as the arm that used to connect there. You got your wits back just as Ruby attacked again, instinctively snapping your right hand, which for some reason still worked. You were teleported to the spot of your severed arm, sitting in the grass. You think and to your shock it moved as though it were still a part of you. You scooped it up and pressed it to your stump and were happy to see that it went back on without issue. "Not a very effective weapon if you ask me." You remark, waving at her with your recently severed limb.
"It's not suppose to be. My father gave it to me as a mark of shame. It cannot hurt people. It is a toy sword, for a pretend warrior." She said dejectedly, looking over her supposed weapon. "But toy or not you shall still feel my vengeance!"
"Not if they have anything to say about it." You say, pointing behind her. Ruby turned and saw a mob a angry townspeople at least two hundred strong, with Tara at the front wielding a sword of some kind, raided from an antiques store judging by the archaic look of it even compared to this time.
"Ha! You think a spattering of towns people could bring me down?! The only reason I've let them live this long was because they amused me." She boasted, standing strong as the mob approached.
"Well, you can take them on like that, but like this?" You snapped your fingers.
Ruby gasped as she dropped three feet in height, now standing at a respectable (but much more manageable) five and a half feet tall. Her sandals now looked like ridiculous clown garb on her, and the blade of her sword alone went up to her sternum, the handle surpassing her head by a little.
Ruby cursed, her enemies circling her as you calmly sat back, materializing pop corn for yourself. Ruby kicked off her now useless sandals, and with one great grunt she heaved her sword into position, sweat trickling off of her chin and onto her buxom as she did. She was still stronger than just about any mortal, man or woman, but still greatly weakened by her loss in mass. "It matters little. Despite losing most of her already subpar god powers Ruby held her own against the villagers, the shear reach of her sword allowing her to cleave through multiple opponents at once. Blow after blow hammered her, club bouncing and sword leaving only thin surface scratches on her strengthened skin. The villagers eventually started to gain the upper hand though, continuously targeting the same small cuts and slightly deepening them with blow after blow, slowly but surely sawing Ruby apart. You were surprised to see a large lack of blood in these cuts, the insides of her arm like a medical cross section only VERY SLIGHTLY bleeding a deeply red blood with very slight but noticeable gold sparkles.
After nearly twenty minutes of attrition based combat the villagers made some headway, and managed to work through the bone of Ruby's right arm. The twitching limb fell to the ground and was quickly snatched up by a villager who got to work sawing it into smaller pieces. Ruby could no longer wield her sword and dropped it to the ground, the heavy point burying itself in the soft soil. She began lashing out with her fists and feet. It was now that the blood started flying, her fist practically decapitating anyone it struck. You saw her kick a man through and through, punt a woman thirty feet into the air to her death, and head butt a guy's noggin into his body. Between your hisses of macabre fascination and disgust you began to wonder why exactly she use that sword in the first place...
Probably because it gave her reach. All of the villagers now tackled her, the combined strength of them overpowering her. Over twenty people clung to each limb, making her unable to move effectively.
Before the villagers could get to work and finish her off a huge crash of thunder blasted behind you, and a booming voice roared "ENOUGH!" Everyone turns to the origin of the noise. Who is it?

"I want her to have my body while I have her giant one!" Tara said enthusiastically.
You were a little disappointed to here how mundane her wish was compared to what you could've done with your god like powers, but you decided to grant it anyway... in your own special way. You were still going to do what she asked you to, but why not spice it up a little, it WAS your job... "Alright, I'll grant you your wish." You say, snapping your fingers.
The first thing that happened was that you two turned visible again, now only twenty feet from the advancing Ruby. "Huh?" Ruby said, her voice very loud but not very deep, definitely not as deep as you were expecting. "Tera, how did you do that? Why aren't you gathering water like I ordered you to?! And who..." She turned to you and stopped speaking, her eyes widening in realization. "YOU!!!" She roared, throwing up an accusatory finger. "You dare show your face in front of me after what you did?!" She demanded, drawing her sword.
You didn't have a chance to make a rebuttal as Ruby charged at you, covering the distance between you two in a fraction of a second. She wound up for a swing but before she could deliver it you snapped your fingers, reappearing one hundred feet behind her, her sword slicing nothing but thin air. She turned around, grinding her teeth furiously as she did. You waved and smiled, causing her the angrily snort. She again covered the distance between you two in less than a second, but was too slow with her sword to catch you before you teleported behind her again. Using your god like powers of deduction you figured that her boots must be magic in some way, increasing her running speed without actually increasing her general speed. She turned to face you again. "STOP RUNNING COWARD! AFTER WHAT YOU DID TO ME THE LEAST YOU COULD DO IS FIGHT ME LIKE A MAN!" She blasted.
"I'm not running, I'm standing perfectly still! What did I do that was so horrible anyway?" You asked both to get under her skin and maybe to get a grasp of what she was talking about.
This actually seemed to take her aback, her arm going slack and her eyes widening in disbelief. "You, you don't remember?" She asked, genuine harm in her voice.
"What can I say? I do a lot of things to a lot of people. Some stuff just slips my mind I guess."
This got her angry again, her grip tightening on the hilt of her blade. "You did this to me!" She spat, pointing to the multitude of scars criss crossing her face. "You tricked me into killing the husband of my sister Jade, you made her attack me! She was always the strongest of Dad's daughters, being born of a dragon herself, I never stood a chance! You made my own father disown me, give me these!" She said, motioning to her boots and sword.
"What's wrong with those? They seem like fine weapons." You remark honestly.
"Don't make me laugh, they are permanent marks of shame! The boots were given to me for running away from Jade, they are the boots of a coward!" She explained, explaining why the boots allowed her to run so fast.

Ruby laughed dejectedly and raised her weapon. With one quick slice she cut her own left hand off, the appendage falling to the ground. To your surprise there was no blood to be seen, and the wound was covered by smooth skin. "This sword cannot kill anything, it's cuts are harmless. It's a toy!" She picked up her hand and reattached it, flexing the fingers to show you that she was fine. "I don't care what it takes, I shall get my vengeance on you!" She boasted, readying her blade.
"That's going to be kind of a problem, because I already promised that girl to get revenge on you." You nonchalantly stated, pointing at Tara who was frozen in shock.
"You slut!" Ruby spat. She turned to charge the helpless servant but before she could you snapped your fingers and granted Tara's wish...

14111221321.content:
"Ah!" Tara yelped as an arrow struck her right in the cheek. Her godly physique kept the arrow from actually sinking in or doing real damage, only the very first few millimeters digging in before the weight of it caused the arrow to dislodge and fall to the ground. Tara looked around, and saw a lone archer along the edge of the island, drawing another arrow from his quiver.
"Let her go!" He demanded, letting fly another projectile. This one as well only just broke the skin of her forehead before falling out.
"Ah, cut that out, it's annoying!" She said, raising her free hand to shield herself. Soon an arrow nearly struck her in the back of the head, catching in her thick hair before it could actually strike her. "What the?!" Another archer, this one a woman in her forties fired a second time, glancing off her hand. "Stop it, you don't understand!" Soon sharp rocks began hitting her back, then thrown knives, then spears, each barely scratching her skin. The villagers had been waiting on the steep shores, preparing for an all out attack.
Tara dropped the now human Ruby, who quickly sprinted out of the fray.
"WAIT, STOP! YOU DON'T UNDERSTAND, THAT GIRL IS RUBY! WE'VE CHANGED BODIES, YOU DON'T UNDERSTAND!" Tara tried to explain. "Eric, tell these people..." She looked around but couldn't see you. "ERIC?!?!?!" You had made yourself and the new Ruby invisible, standing at a safe distance while Tara cursed and screamed.
Both Tara and Ruby were stunned at your betrayal, Tara drawing her sword and lashing out at her attackers while Ruby stared at you in silence. It was clear that Tara was not the warrior that Ruby was, her attacks clumsy and her dashes seemingly uncontrolled. She began slowing down as more of the attacks hammered her. Tara touched her skin and felt a strange liquid on it, thicker than sweat and not clear.
"Poison." You explain to Ruby, who was just piecing it together herself. "It probably won't kill her, but neither will the flicks the villagers are doing." Tara began flopping around, unable to coordinate her limbs any more. "Let's go, this is getting boring!" You say to Ruby, extending your hand to her. She looked at you for a very long time, unable to accept the fact that you were helping her. She eventually took your hand hesitantly, allowing you to lead her off.
With a snap of your fingers the two of you were in a bar many many miles away, both of you now fully dressed. You had disguised yourself slightly, giving yourself a more aged appearance with a pointed blond beard and a scar over your right eye. Ruby didn't seem so surprised, taking the drink that was in front of her without even questioning its contents and swilling it like a man twice her newly reduced size. She gave a sharp exhale and set her mug down, wiping her lips with her baggy new shirt. "So, why'd you help me?" She asked, cutting right to the chase.
"That depends, why aren't you attacking me?" You retorted.
"Because you helped me, now why did you help me?" She shot back without pause.
Your face became more sober despite the alcohol you in took, and you looked her in the eyes. "Look, I feel bad for what I did, alright? I may be a trickster but I think I took it too far that time. I ruined your life and fucked up your whole family, it was a shitty thing to do. So I intend to make it up to you a little, give you a new life. Let you start fresh. What do you say?" You ask.
Ruby was silent. She slurped the last of her drink and then responded. "Do you seriously think I'm that stupid?"
Your facade cracked and you broke into a smile. "Damn you're good. Fooled you for a little, didn't I?"
"Not even. I know you too well uncle Eric." She tapped a passing barmaid who took her empty mug, looking back and forth between the mug and the woman in disbelief, before leaving to get her another drink. "So, why are you really helping me?" She asked.
"To fuck with Randell and his other punk kids, mostly. Now that you're a new you and Tara is taking the fall in your place you can get closer to them without arousing suspicion. Come on, don't you want some pay back for what they did to you?" You ask.
"You made them do it!" She shouted, slamming her fist on the table. She retracted it, cradling it to her buxom as she hissed in pain. Her dainty human hand wasn't built like her demigod one. "Still, you are right. You may have set things up, but they all turned on me in instant. They didn't let me explain, they didn't let me apologize, they wouldn't even take back what they had done after they had learned that it was all your fault..." Ruby thought, kissing her hand. Another drink was set before her and she chugged a third of it, amazing you with her brain's ability to take alcohol even in a human body.
"I'll tell you what. You help me play some tricks on Randell and his snotty little kids, and I'll give you new powers. One power per hit." You bargained.
This caught her attention. "One power of my choice?" She asked.
"Within reason. No power giving you more powers and no super ambiguous powers. I'll give you one magic power for every person you help me with, so long as I can provide you with it. After all, I myself have limits." You say. You knew you did have some limits but you had no idea what they were. You were just adding that in in case she asked for something that it turns out you couldn't provide. "If you say no I'll let you go here. You can begin a new human life in this big city I've dropped you off in. I'll even let you keep the clothes you have and the gold in your pocket."
She checked and indeed a pouch with about a year's living worth of gold was strapped to her side. She thought, slowly sipping her drink. She finally says...

Now this looked promising! A brown haired beauty with eyes that glistened like fire... all of that locked up in a mental hospital! Her arms and legs were chained to the wall behind her, her head slowly swaying in circles as she talked to herself. It was weird for you to hear a crazy person pray. The words she spoke were just gibberish and random sounds, but the words in her head sounded... strangely smooth. Her thoughts seemed to flow much more clearly, much more focused than other mortals, it just seemed like she couldn't keep her thoughts on any one thing at any time, but whatever did enter her thoughts got her full attention until the next thought entered her mind. It was hard to describe in mortal terms.
With a snap of your fingers you teleport yourself into her cell, a small and dank brick rectangle without any furniture, and with the only thing for entertainment was a barred window at about the woman's eye level which overlooked a small patch of grassland with a lush forest on its periphery. The woman immediately lifted her head to look at you, her slightly not right gaze burrowing into you. She smiled, revealing a set of perfect chompers (huh, this place has a great dental plan for a medieval loony bin) and a pair of cute dimples. You look down at her body momentarily and see that while very sexy, with perfectly curved hips and perky breasts concealed only by a stained white gown, she was unwell. Her arms and legs had been lacerated badly, cuts and bruises on nearly every inch of them. As well she hung off of the by her chained wrists while her feet were sprawled under her, perhaps lacking the strength to stand.
She spoke to you, her spoken words meaningless but her thoughts clear. "Oh glorious Eric, thank you for arriving to aid me! I was worried that you wouldn't come and help me!" She cheered in her mind.
"It's no problem, really. Anything to help out a nice specimen like yourself." You say slyly, snapping your fingers. The woman gasped in ecstasy as a warming wave slowly rolled through her. The cuts on her limbs vanished, restoring her silky smooth skin. You snap again but this time you are disappointed. You are able to restore her original body strength, that of an average person, but you're unable to give her more strength then that. It seems that you could morph bodies and parts, and make parts equal in strength to what you morphed it into (eg give someone a minotaur or giant body and they'll have the strength of a minotaur or giant) but you can't actually augment the body, probably because that was Randell's thing. Damn.
"Thank you kindly merciful Eric, I did not even wish for that!" She thought.
"Not a problem at all, just consider it a freebie. Now, what can I help you with miss...?" You ask casually, leaning on the wall as the woman stands up on her own.
"Nora. Just call me Nora my lord. Anyway, I've been locked up in this asylum for almost nine months, fourteen days, six hours, and seven seconds. Eight seconds. Nine seconds. Ten seconds. Eleven sec-"
You cut her off "Nora?"
"Yes?" She says and thinks simultaneously.
"What do you need?" You ask, hoping to break her out of that cycle and get her back on track.
"Well lord Eric..."

14333.content:
"I know that we ARE telling the truth here, and that the more people believe that believe in you the more powerful you get, but a few white lies to coerce them into believing quicker can't hurt, right? I mean in the end it's just accelerating your growth." Monica rationalized.
"What are you talking about?" You pant out, totally lost as Monica is speaking more to herself than to you.
"My aunt can probably help us with some ideas. She's a... she's a less than legal stage performer, specializing in taking large sums of money from gullible and desperate people." Monica explains as tactfully as she can.
You raise an eyebrow "You mean a con artist?"
Monica hisses "She doesn't like it when people refer to her job like that. She prefers to call herself, in her own words not mine, a 'professional magician of the economic arts'."
You shrug and raise your hands in a mockingly defensive manner. "Hey I'm not judging or anything. We all have bills to pay, and some of us have skills more suited to different kinds of work. So what's this aunt's name, and where does she live?"
"Her name is Helena, and last I remember she's living in a hotel downtown. She doesn't like to stay in one place for too long so she may have moved since then." Monica explains.
You resist the urge to drop your haw as a horrible realization dawns on you. "Wait, she's a con artist named Helena? Is she about five foot five, with dyed black hair, small gray bags under her eyes, in her late twenties, and has an obvious boob job?" You inquire.
Monica looks at you perplexedly. "Yes on the first three, she just turned thirty about three months ago, and her boobs are all natural. I know they look too springy but as far as I can remember they always looked like that. You know her?"
"Yeah, she stole my wallet." You vaguely explain, telling the truth but leaving out many key details. You had several run ins with Helena close to two years ago, right after your first break up with Monica. You ran into her in the alley behind the mall on your way home and she made a bet with you. She bet that she could take your wallet without you even noticing it. If she could take your wallet from right in front of you without getting caught she'd get to keep half of the money inside of it, and if you caught her you'd win one hundred dollars. You accepted her terms and before you could even tell what was happening she pulled your pants to your ankles, shoved you to wall, and began sucking you off as though the fate of humanity depended on it. Needless to say she won the bet. Did she con you? Yes. Was it technically statutory rape? You were fourteen and a half at the time, so yes. Did you go back and demand a rematch five more times over the next two weeks? No, you did so six times. You think Helena might have actually liked your attention (and other things belonging to you) as she took less of your cash each time, leaving you with three fourths of it on your last session. Shortly after that Monica took you back and you never told her about your sessions with Helena. While you weren't necessarily cheating you would really prefer that Monica never find out.
"Great, so you already know how good she is!" Monica says, thankfully missing the wince her accidental double entendre caused. The two of you bus down town as your car was back at your house and Monica didn't have a vehicle of her own. After twenty minutes of busing the two of you arrive at a downtown shopping district, and Monica leads you to the hotel she believed Helena to be residing at. After twenty minutes of walking you find the place, a rather upscale hotel located near the center of the financial district, and luckily enough for the two of you Helena's name was still there, the person at the front desk informing you that she was in room 266.
Monica and you find the room, near the end of a hall, and Monica stops before the door. She seems to think for half a a quarter of a minute, scratching her head as if trying to remember something. She snaps and gives and "aha!" as she recalls what she needed to. Monica knocks twice, pauses, knocks two more times, pauses, and finishes with three rapid knocks. The two of you hear light footsteps approach the the door. Soon enough it is swung open and you come face to face with a familiar con woman. Helena was wearing a short black skirt and a black sleeveless shirt that ended above her navel. Her feet were clad in black boots that were a little more rugged than typical ladies footwear, likely due to the need for practical running wear in her profession. Her face had small amounts of makeup on it but it was really only needed and concentrated under her eyes, where stress had caused wear and tear to the area in spite of how youthful she looked otherwise. As you remember her chest seemed impossible given her relationship with Monica. They weren't huge, falling far below Cynthia and her kin in the size department, but they were almost super humanly round and perky, barely sagging a degree. Helena smiled "What's up my little twerp?" She said with her distinctive Boston accent.
"Oh not much, but me and Eric here were wondering if we could get some help for a project. Mind if we come in?" Monica asked.
Helena rolled her eyes and sighed in exasperation. "Ugh, you know I don't approve of you getting into my line of work. We've been over this, family doesn't compete with family! Whatever, come in." She said, motioning for you two to enter which you both did, Monica stepping in first.
It was very subtle, you almost missed it yourself, but as you passed Helena you heard her whisper as softly as a mouse "Long time no see." You don't respond, but the fact that she hadn't attempted to sell you out yet was at least a little comforting.
The two of you sit down on a luxurious and comfortable couch as Helena sits across from you on a plushy arm chair. "So, down to business. We need your help convincing the world that Eric here is a god." Monica said formally.
Helena didn't even have to think before responding in equally casual manner "Not a good idea. God acts don't work in the long run, and the two of you are way too green to handle an operation that big. Go smaller."
Monica smiled. "But here's the thing. Eric really IS a god."
This caught Helena's attention, her gaze shifting to you, then back to her niece. "What?" She questioned disbelievingly.
Monica explained everything that had happened up until that point. You deal with Alkazar, the first uses of your powers, your current predicament, everything. When she finished Helena looked much less amused. "Look, kid, you're starring to insult me. Whatever act you're trying to pull on me ain't working. You can't fool a professional." She said.
"This is no act Helena, I assure you." Monica said before turning to you. "Eric, why don't you give Helena here a demonstration of your powers?" You agree and decide to...

You announced, remembering to use the fake names as per Helena's instructions. Surprised by your decision to skip an act it takes Monica several moments to walk through the curtains though immediately the mumbling crowd is silenced.
Helena had done a good makeup job, Monica looked like she was on death's door. Gaunt skin, cheekbones heavily pronounced and eye sockets sunken in by flawless application of shading, head completely shaved (it was rather hard to convince Monica to do that but the effect it gave was well worth it) and of course, her thin nearly see through patient's outfit (Sewn together by Helena herself, quite an amazing feat considering that she only had feet to work with) showing off her lack of assets. After you allow the tension to build for a few more seconds you begin your prepared speech. "Morgan, as you can all plainly see, isn't well. Doctors around the country are baffled, they can't even figure out what's wrong with her much less help her. Their best guess is that she has a new form of breast cancer, one that, even after the most invasive oof treatments including chemotherapy and a double mastectomy, has reduced her lifespan to a few scant weeks." The eyes are pitch black, with neither irises nor pupil, though as you look closer, you see that what at first seemed to be two black pits in the creatures skull are actually full of tiny light resembling stars and planets, galaxies and nebula's, and entire cosmos contained within the gaze of the heavenly being before you.

Tearing your gaze away before you become lost forever in that gaze you stammer "W-who or w-what are you?"

In a voice like the rumbling of thunder the being intones I AM ALKAZAR, SELF APPOINTED GUARDIAN OF THE COSMIC BALANCE, AND POSSESSED OF POWER FAR GREATER THAN ANYTHING YOUR FEEBLE MORTAL MIND COULD HOPE TO COMPREHEND!" the god like being intones.

And, what do you want with me?" you asked nervously, certain in that moment that this Alkazar was a being sent from the heavens to drag you down to hell for you sinful ways, just like your mother always said would happen ever since she discovered you were a lesbian. Thankfully, the mighty figures next sentence sets your mind at ease, though only somewhat.

"I HAVE COME ALEXIS MONROE, TO MAKE YOU AN OFFER. I HAVE CHOSEN, FOR REASONS OF MY OWN FAR TOO COMPLEX FOR YOU TO UNDERSTAND TO GRANT TO YOU A SINGLE WISH, ONE WHICH WILL EFFECT THE ENTIRETY OF THE HUMAN RACE IN THE MANNER OF YOUR CHOOSING." the ancient Alkazar explains.

What is your culture like? What about your technology?" said, asking one question after another, as it's almost certainly mankind's first peaceful encounter with intelligent alien life in, well, who knows how long, and the more you can learn, the more likely people are to believe you.

I shall accept no other terms." the all powerful entity intones.

Too frightened by the beings threats to even think of arguing, you quickly make the first wish that comes to mind. "Alright, alright! Just don't kill me!" you plead. "I wish______________________________?"

1522111.content:
Standing in the doorway is an alien female. Surprisingly human looking and quite lovely with a thick mane of raven black hair down to her waist, large eyes like two black pits lacking both whites and iris, set within a narrow, delicate face with a small nose and full pouty lips.Slender of build and slightly shorter than you, the being is dressed in flowing robes of dark blue and gold, with grayish skin and a small pair of back swept horns vaguely resembling those of a goat jutting out from her forehead. "Uh, I really hope you're about to tell me that you come in peace?" you said.

The being doesn't respond immediately, instead moving forward into the room, allowing you to spot the something you hadn't noticed before. The alien females feet never actually touch the ground, indeed, she may not even have any for all you know as, if they are present, they are completely hidden beneath the creatures robes, the hem of which float a few inches above the floor without any sort of visible support whatsoever. Coming to within a couple of feet of you, the creature appears to study you for a moment, with you doing the same in return, providing you with yet another shock. You had thought they were merely hidden behind her back before, but upon getting a better look you're shocked to find that this alien female appears to be completely armless, her robes containing neither sleeves nor armholes of any sort, nor do her robes appear to be concealing them, though you suppose you could be mistaken. Apparently satisfied that you're not an immediate threat, the grey skinned humanoid moves right up next to you, her face mere inches from your own, and you find yourself positively compelled to meet her gaze, those big black eyes of hers pulling you in, and suddenly you find yourself thrust into the void, a dark emptiness spreading out from you in every direction, the only signs of life being you and the alien female who seems to have accompanied you to... well, where ever it is this is. "Where, where are we?" you whisper nervously, half afraid to disturb the oppressive silence of this place in which you find yourself.

For the first time, the alien female speaks! "This is the mental realm human, a place where our minds can meet, allowing us to communicate mind to mind without the barriers of language between us." she said.

"Wait, you mean you're in my brain?!" you asked incredulously, not quite believing it even after everything else that's happened recently.

Upon hearing this the alien female laughs, a sound that reminds you of the tinkling of bells before replying "Hummph! Certainly not! You lack any where near the mental discipline required to create and sustain your own mental landscape. No, we are in my mind, at least, the small portion I have chosen to allow you to access. Now, down to business. My crew and I were surveying a nearby sector of space, when an unknown phenomenon dragged us several light years off course. It proved to be a fortuitous accident however, as imagine our surprise when we discovered a small blue planet with conditions very similar to our home world circling an M-class star and containing the very thing we were in search of, intelligent humanoid life. Of course, we had no intention of contacting your governments right away, not until we had a better idea of what your people were like and what sort of reaction we could expect should we make our presence know to the public at large." she explained.

"Uh, you know you made the six O'clock news right?" you said.

The alien female sighs. "That was an unfortunate error on our part. One of our collection drones cloaking devices was damaged in the same event that led us here, causing it to malfunction briefly, something we were unaware of until it was too late. The issue is being resolved even now. Now, before we go any further, what is your designation? I am known as Eviee Wan, chief diplomat of this vessel."

"Uh, my name, er, designation is Adam Tate. And um, could you please tell me what it is you plan to do with me?" you asked a little bit nervously, though surely this Eviee creature wouldn't be being so free with her information if they just intended to kill you or enslave you or something?

Eviee doesn't hesitate in the least, simply replying________________________?

15221112.content:
"What?!" you exclaim, unable to believe what it is you've just heard.

"You seem disturbed. Let me explain." Eviee said. "Our species, the Galval, is a matriarchal society, with females outnumbering males approximately ten to one. This huge gender imbalance makes those few males we do possess rare and precious, jealously guarded by the rich and powerful. For this reason, many young females are never allowed a chance to breed, something that's become quite a problem, not only due to the reduction of our population this causes, but also due to the effects it has on those young females mental states, as their inability to achieve sexual gratification during their time of estrus can have a significant negative impact on their mood and their ability to concentrate. This last detail is a serious issue for our species, as it can cause the females in question to loose control over their psychic abilities, making them a threat to themselves and everyone around them until they can be properly treated. Though the search for knowledge and available resources is important to us, it's the search for species similar enough to our own to provide mates for our young ones that is the true driving force of our exploration efforts."

"So, wait, so you're seriously telling me, that you people traveled halfway across the galaxy and abducted me in broad daylight, all just so I could sex up some horny alien chick who can't find a male of her own species to play with?! Is this some kind of joke?" you demanded incredulously.

"Though I'm certain such a concept seems strange to you, what with your own species genders being so closely matched in number and lacking the same breeding compulsions my own race suffers from, but I can assure you that every thing I have told you so far is the complete and utter truth. Now, I ask you, will you cooperate with us in our efforts, or must we resort to milking your for your DNA like some sort of beast?"

You think about the alien females proposal. While having your sperm mechanically harvested is certainly something you want to avoid, you're not too keen on being treated like some sort of male whore either. On the other hand, you've never really been particularly popular with the ladies back on earth, being somewhat overweight, with bad skin and poor vision, your distinct lack of confidence or any great amount of wealth not helping matters either. And if all Galval females look as good as Eviee.... sure the horns, grey skin and complete lack of arms will take a little getting used to, but you doubt that'll be a problem. You decide to ask.

"Do all the females of your species look as good as you?"

For the first time, Eviee actually laughs. "Hah! You flatter an old woman! Actually, from what we've learned of your sexual practices, we believe that most males of your species would find our young females very attractive indeed, far more so than myself, I am rather old after all. You have most likely noted by now however, that I lack the same number of extremities as the typical female of your own species, something that I hope you won't find too disturbing, as such a condition is quite common among Galval females, for reasons that we will discuss at a latter date. For now however, can I assume from your question that you intend to cooperate with us in our efforts?" she asked.

Nodding slowly you replied "Yes, I'll cooperate, for now at least. I'd like to learn as much as possible about your species and culture, and honestly if the other members of your species are anywhere near as hot as you claim, I'd have to be crazy, married, gay, or dead to turn it down, and since none of those apply, I'm all yours."

"Excellent." Eviee replied. "This room will be your sleeping chamber, with the replicators providing any nutritional needs you may possess, and you will reside here whenever you are not otherwise engaged, though you will be allowed to move around the ship under escort, with more freedom forthcoming once we have seen enough to deem you trustworthy." she explained.

"I understand. It's not as though you actually know anything about me after all." you acknowledged.

"I'm glad you understand the situation. And now on to our final matter of business, how are you at languages?" Eviee inquired.

"Languages? I guess I'm alright. I got a B in spanish back in high school. Why do you ask?"

"I ask because one of the talents I have cultivated over the course of my life involves a method by which I can acquire the ability to learn languages quickly, as well as teaching them to others. However, it requires me to deeply immerse myself in the thoughts and memories of the subject I wish to teach or learn from, a process that some sentient life forms find distasteful, not only due to the fact that there is some measure of pain involved with the process, but also because it lays bare before me all the participants thoughts, memories and emotions, including those that they might rather have remain hidden. I typically try not to dwell on such information while I work, so as to allow the subject as much privacy as possible, but the information is available nonetheless, something I thought you should be aware of before agreeing to such a procedure." Eviee explained.

"I see. And how long would this procedure take?" you asked, uncertain whether you really wanted anyone, alien or otherwise, delving into your private thoughts, but if it helps you to learn their language faster than it might well be worth considering.

"I won't know for sure until I attempt the procedure, but most likely no more than a couple of hours, after which you should be be capable of speaking our language just as well as you do your native tongue." Eviee answered.

"And without the procedure? How long do you think it would take me to learn your language then?" you inquired.

Eviee seems to hesitate before eventually answering "It's difficult for me to say, as we really understand little about human learning potential at this point, but in my personal opinion, I believe it would take several months at least for you to be capable of carrying on even the most basic of conversations, with several years beyond that required to master the language, provided you ever manage to do so."

"I see. Well, I guess we don't really have a lot of choice then, not unless I want to wait half a year or more before learning anything about you. Anyway, it's not like I really have a lot of secrets anyway, so go ahead and do what you need to do." you eventually replied.

"Very well, but not here, and not now. This procedure would be better performed in sick bay so as to minimize any problems that may occur due to any differences in our species brain chemistry. I also require time to rest and prepare myself before such an endeavor, so please, rest here for the night, and someone will come to fetch you in the morning. Oh, and if by any chance you find yourself wishing to begin your mating duties early, or have any sort of problems, please fell free to press the green and red buttons respectively, and someone will come to assist you in short order." Eviee said before abruptly disappearing into the darkness, which swiftly fades away, leaving you standing back in the room you had just left, with the real Eviee floating in front of you. Boeing slightly, she turns and floats over to the door, which opens on it's own, allowing her to leave the chamber, before closing and locking itself behind her, leaving you alone once more. That begs the question, what should you do now? While sleep is certainly tempting, as your day so far has been emotionally stressful to say the least, the thought of sexing up an alien fem is also appealing, especially if the average Galval girl is even half as attractive as Eviee claims.
